properties.caption: "The revolution will be feminist or will not be." © Eric Zolov.
"Fight Like a Girl." © Eric Zolov.
"Without country / Without fear / Queer love is RESISTANCE." © Eric Zolov.
"In a State of Rebellion." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"State of Rebellion": performance piece by Yeguada Latinoamericana. Photograph by Juan Pablo Miranda. Photo courtesy of Cheril Linett.
"Not Yours Not the Cops'": paste-up by Lolo Góngora. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"If you violate [rape] women / we will violate your laws!!" © Eric Zolov.
Performance piece in front of the Vera Cruz Church: "What hurts you? What makes you angry? Write on us!" © Eric Zolov.
Graffiti mural: "THE OPPRESSIVE STATE IS A MACHO RAPIST." © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"The Oppressive State is a Macho Rapist": illustration by Marcela Paz Peña (Isonauta). © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
Lolo Góngora paste-up: "The Rapist Is You!" © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Or will not be"—a shorthand reference to the central feminist slogan of the uprising. © Eric Zolov.
Montage with block print graphic: "March 8, Liberated Woman." ©Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"We Women are Always on the Front Line": paste-up by Lolo Góngora at GAM. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"Holy Dignity": paste-up by Paloma Rodríguez in the gold frame of the Museo de la Dignidad. © Eric Zolov.
"MACHO MAN lose your privileges": graffiti on the side of the Arzobispo Bridge. © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
"A dead cop doesn’t rape." © Eric Zolov.
"Legal abortion / Fire to the patriarchal state." © Eric Zolov.
"Abort the heterocapitalist patriarchal system." © Eric Zolov.
"Nicole Saavedra Bahamondes / Assassinated for Being a Visible Lesbian": paste-up by Marcela Paz Peña (Isonauta). © Terri Gordon-Zolov.
